cards.title: Barcelona beat Juventus to win the Champions League: brick-by-brick
cards.rawTitle: Barcelona beat Juventus to win the Champions League: brick-by-brick

item.title: Barcelona beat Juventus to win the Champions League: brick-by-brick
item.trailText: Barcelona completed a domestic and European treble with an exciting, yet convincing 3-1 win over Juventus at the Olympiastadion in Berlin. Here are the highlights painstakingly recreated, brick-by-brick
item.standFirst:
Barcelona completed a domestic and European treble with an exciting, yet convincing 3-1 win over Juventus at the Olympiastadion in Berlin. Barça's Ivan Rakitic scored after just four minutes, with Real Madrid old boy Alvaro Morata levelling things up after half-time. Goals from Luis Suárez and Neymar then gave the Catalan side the lead, and subsequently the title. Here are the highlights painstakingly recreated, brick-by-brick.

• Audio from Sky Sports

cards.title: Arsenal's FA Cup final win over Aston Villa: brick-by-brick
cards.rawTitle: Arsenal's FA Cup final win over Aston Villa: brick-by-brick

item.title: Arsenal's FA Cup final win over Aston Villa: brick-by-brick
item.trailText: Watch the animated highlights of Arsenal v Aston Villa including the goals from Theo Walcott, Alexis Sanchez, Per Mertesacker and Olivier Giroud
item.standFirst:
Arsenal's record-breaking 12th FA Cup win came at the expense of an Aston Villa side who completed 90 minutes at Wembley without a shot on target. Here are the animated highlights of the game: the goals from Theo Walcott, Alexis Sánchez, Per Mertesacker and Olivier Giroud; and the celebrations, painstakingly recreated, brick by brick

• Audio from the BBC

cards.title: Champions League Final 2005: brick-by-brick
cards.rawTitle: Champions League Final 2005: brick-by-brick

item.title: Champions League Final 2005: brick-by-brick
item.trailText: Ten years have gone by since the night in Istanbul when Liverpool came back from 3-0 down at half-time in the Champions League final to lift the trophy, winning on penalties after a three-goal, six-minute burst in the second half brought them level. Here is all of the drama painstakingly recreated, brick-by-brick
item.standFirst:
Ten years have gone by since the night in Istanbul when Liverpool came back from 3-0 down at half-time in the Champions League final to lift the trophy, winning on penalties after a three-goal, six-minute burst in the second half brought them level. Here is all of the drama painstakingly recreated, brick-by-brick

(audio from ITV)

cards.title: Nayim, Ronaldinho and Beckham: three great lobs - brick-by-brick video
cards.rawTitle: Nayim, Ronaldinho and Beckham: three great lobs - brick-by-brick video

item.title: Nayim, Ronaldinho and Beckham: three great lobs - brick-by-brick video
item.trailText: To commemorate the 20th anniversary of Nayim's extraordinary last-minute lob for Real Zaragoza against Arsenal in the 1995 Cup Winners' Cup final, here is that goal reconstructed brick by brick, along with two other memorable lobs
item.standFirst: To commemorate the 20th anniversary of Nayim's extraordinary last-minute lob for Real Zaragoza against Arsenal in the 1995 Cup Winners' Cup final, here is that goal reconstructed brick by brick, along with two other memorable lobs – Ronaldinho beating David Seaman in the 2002 World Cup quarter-finals and David Beckham announcing himself as a player with his goal from the halfway line against Wimbledon in 1996

cards.title: Matt Le Tissier's top three goals – brick-by-brick video
cards.rawTitle: Matt Le Tissier's top three goals – brick-by-brick video

item.title: Matt Le Tissier's top three goals – brick-by-brick video
item.trailText: An animated brick-by-brick reconstruction of Matt Le Tissier's top three goals, as chosen by the man himself, against Blackburn Rovers, Newcastle United and Wimbledon
item.standFirst:
An animated brick-by-brick reconstruction of Matt Le Tissier's best goals from his career. Revisit his controlled, balletic demolition of Newcastle United, his flicked-up free-kick masterpiece against Wimbledon, and his dribble and long-range thumper against Blackburn Rovers. These are his personal top three goals.

• Watch Matt Le Tissier interviewed by Barry Glendenning

cards.rawTitle: Germany beat Argentina to win the World Cup – brick-by-brick video animation

item.title: Germany beat Argentina to win the World Cup – brick-by-brick video animation
item.trailText: In the final match of the 2014 World Cup, Germany's Mario Götze scores the decisive goal in extra time to bring home the coveted trophy
item.standFirst: In the final match of the 2014 World Cup, Germany's Mario Götze scores the decisive goal in extra time to bring home the coveted trophy. Argentina looked like they had opened the scoring, but Gonzalo Higuaín's close-range finish was disallowed for offside. Joachim Löw's team then go on to complete their Brazil 2014 triumph

cards.rawTitle: World Cup 2014's greatest bits – brick-by-brick video

item.title: World Cup 2014's greatest bits – brick-by-brick video
item.trailText: A look back at some of the highlights of the 2014 Brazil World Cup – rendered in brick form
item.standFirst: A look back at the highlights of the World Cup – rendered in brick form – beginning with Brazil's defeat of Croatia and featuring England's opening loss to Italy. We revisit Pepe's butting madness, Suárez playing hero and villain, poster-boy Neymar's injury and Brazil's humiliating exit

cards.rawTitle: Brazil v Colombia at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation

item.title: Brazil v Colombia at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation
item.trailText: Watch the hosts defeat Colombia to continue their World Cup dream
item.standFirst: Watch the hosts defeat Colombia to continue their World Cup dream. Goals from Thiago Silva and David Luiz put Brazil in control before James Rodríguez pulls a goal back to ensure a nervy finish. A bad tempered game sees a number of bad challenges including one which ended Neymar's World Cup

cards.rawTitle: France v Nigeria at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation

item.title: France v Nigeria at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation
item.trailText: Despite France having a number of chances, including two in quick succession for Karim Benzema, Nigeria went toe to to with their opponents until late in the game
item.standFirst: Despite France having a number of chances, including two in quick succession for Karim Benzema, Nigeria went toe to to with their opponents until a header from Paul Pogba late on in the game. An own goal from the Super Eagles' Joseph Yobo set the seal on Les Bleus' progression into the quarter-finals, where they meet Germany

cards.rawTitle: USA v Germany at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation

item.title: USA v Germany at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation
item.trailText: Watch our unique highlights as Thomas Müller scores his fourth goal of the World Cup as Germany beat the United States in Recife
item.standFirst: Thomas Müller scored his fourth goal of the World Cup as Germany beat the United States in Recife. The win means that Germany qualify as Group G winners, but the United States were unlucky not to get something from the game. Fortunately for Jürgen Klinsmann and his side, they still qualify for the last 16

item.title: Holland v Chile at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation
item.trailText: In their final match in Group B, Holland beat Chile to take top spot. Relive the match with our unique highlights
item.standFirst: In their final match in Group B, Holland beat Chile to take top spot. Second-half goals from substitutes Leroy Fer and Memphis Depay see Holland through to the last 16, where they will meet Mexico. Chile, meanwhile, will face hosts Brazil in a tantalising encounter

item.title: England v Uruguay at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation
item.trailText: The latest in our brick-by-brick recreations of the World Cup sees England crash out of the tournament thanks to two goals from Uruguay's Luis Suárez
item.standFirst: The latest in our brick-by-brick recreations of the World Cup sees England crash out of the tournament thanks to two goals from Uruguay's Luis Suárez. Despite a goal from Wayne Rooney briefly raising English hopes, the Three Lions exited the finals at the earliest point since 1958

cards.rawTitle: Germany v Portugal at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation

item.title: Germany v Portugal at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation
item.trailText: Germany thrash Portugal 4-0 at the World Cup 2014, recreated brick-by-brick
item.standFirst: Portugal were expected to be galvanised by a match-fit Cristiano Ronaldo, but Germany hadn't read that script and treated their opponents to a 4-0 thrashing. Thomas Müller scored the tournament's first hat-trick and was also at the centre of an incident off the ball that saw Portugal's Pepe sent off for a headbutt

item.trailText: England play Italy at the Arena Amazônia in this brick-by-brick recreation of their Group D match
item.standFirst: England play Italy at the Arena Amazônia in this brick-by-brick recreation of their Group D match. Daniel Sturridge gets a first World Cup goal for Roy Hodgson's young side; but the Azzurri come out on top thanks to Claudio Marchisio's opener and a Mario Balotelli goal in the second half

item.title: Brazil v Croatia at World Cup 2014 – brick-by-brick video animation
item.trailText: Brick-by-brick returns for the World Cup 2014 in Brazil, starting with the opening match as the hosts take on Croatia at the Itaquerão stadium in São Paulo
item.standFirst: Brick-by-brick returns for the World Cup 2014 in Brazil, starting with the opening match as the hosts take on Croatia at the Itaquerão stadium in São Paulo. The game featured an opening own goal, a contentious penalty and two goals from Brazilian superstar Neymar. There will be more brick-by-brick recreations throughout the tournament

item.standFirst: Dennis Bergkamp, Carlos Alberto and Diego Maradona stake a claim for the best World Cup goal ever while Zidane, Massing and the Zaire national team play dirty. Watch a montage of some of the most memorable moments from tournaments past, lovingly recreated brick-by-brick

cards.rawTitle: Diego Maradona scores solo goal against England, 1986: brick-by-brick animation of a classic World Cup moment

item.title: Diego Maradona scores solo goal against England, 1986: brick-by-brick animation of a classic World Cup moment
item.trailText: One of the best World Cup goals ever, lovingly recreated brick-by-brick
item.standFirst: It's fair to say Argentina's Diego Maradona had a decent game against England in the 1986 World Cup. After the notorious 'hand of God' incident, he sealed victory over Bobby Robson's side with a strike that's gone down as one of the best World Cup goals ever. Watch it here, lovingly recreated brick-by-brick

cards.title: Zaire's Mwepu Ilunga defends a free-kick, 1974: brick-by-brick video animation of a classic World Cup moment
cards.rawTitle: Zaire's Mwepu Ilunga defends a free-kick, 1974: brick-by-brick video animation of a classic World Cup moment

item.title: Zaire's Mwepu Ilunga defends a free-kick, 1974: brick-by-brick video animation of a classic World Cup moment
item.trailText: Zaire's Mwepu Ilunga defends a set piece against Brazil during the 1974 World Cup in this brick-by-brick video animation
item.standFirst: It may not be the best defence of a free-kick ever, but it's certainly the most memorable. When Zaire lined up opposite a Brazilian set piece in the 1974 World Cup, no one could have imagined how Mwepu Ilunga was going to produce one of the most stunning moments in the tournament's history. Here it is lovingly recreated, brick-by-brick style

stillImage.caption: Zaire's Mwepu Ilunga defends a free kick during the 1974 World Cup in this brick-by-brick video animation Photograph: guardian.co.uk/guardian.co.uk

cards.rawTitle: Benjamin Massing's tackle on Caniggia, 1990: brick-by-brick video animation of a classic World Cup moment

item.title: Benjamin Massing's tackle on Caniggia, 1990: brick-by-brick video animation of a classic World Cup moment
item.trailText: Animated reconstruction of one of the most spectacular fouls in World Cup history: Cameroon's Benjamin Massing's demolition of Argentina's Claudio Caniggia in 1990
item.standFirst:
In the run-up to the 2014 World Cup in Brazil we're publishing a series of brick-by-brick reconstructions of classic moments from previous tournaments. Here we commemorate one of the most spectacular fouls ever seen in the tournament: Cameroon's Benjamin Massing's demolition of Argentina's Claudio Caniggia in the opening match of the 1990 World Cup

• More brick-by-brick animations of World Cup classics

item.title: Zinedine Zidane headbutts Marco Materazzi: brick-by-brick World Cup reconstruction – video animation
item.trailText: A recreation of the shocking moment in the final of the 2006 World Cup when Zinedine Zidane headbutted Italy's Marco Materazzi
item.standFirst: In the run-up to the 2014 World Cup in Brazil we're publishing a series of brick-by-brick reconstructions of classic moments from previous World Cups. Here's our take on the shocking moment in the final of the 2006 World Cup when Zinedine Zidane headbutted Italy's Marco Materazzi
